data.title: Antonia Fraser
data.meta_description: Antonia Fraser. Writer: Jemima Shore Investigates. Antonia Fraser was born on 27 August 1932 in London, England, UK. She is a writer and actress, known for Jemima Shore Investigates (1983), Die unglaublichen Geschichten von Roald Dahl (1979) and Armchair Thriller (1978). She was previously married to Harold Pinter and Hugh Charles Patrick Joseph Fraser.
data.text:
She was awarded the CBE (Commander of the Order of the British Empire) in the 1999 Queen's Birthday Honours List for her services to Literature.

Attended Dragoon School, and, after her conversion to Roman Catholicism, St. Mary's Convent School in South Ascot, England.

Nearly killed by an IRA car bomb in the 1970s in which her first husband was targeted. Caroline Kennedy, the daughter of the late President, could have been a passenger in the car that day as she was staying with the Frasers on holiday.
